Professor Goodwin,

I, too, am using the sim.sensitivity function.  I'm usi=
ng IdealGasMix 
with an H2/O2/N2O mechanism.  I have calculated the sensiti=
vities for 
1% H2, 0.5% O2 and 98.5% N2.  When I compare my results with re=
sults 
from previous work for the same conditions, I find reaction 
sensiti=
vities to significantly different reactions.  I've checked the 
pre-exponen=
tial terms and they are slightly different but the 
reactions should show t=
he same trend relative to one another and they 
don't.  For example, my res=
ults show the most significant reactions 
are recombination/dissociation re=
actions, while the previous results 
show chain reactions as the most signi=
ficant, which makes sense.  So, 
I'm wondering, is there any other document=
ation that describes the 
output from the sensitivity1.py script?

I've als=
o tried using GRI30() but the results don't match when I 
consider the pre-=
expontential terms from each mechanism.   Is there 
anything hardcoded into=
 GRI30() that isn't captured in IdealGasMix 
that might change the sensitiv=
ities?

Thanks in advance for your help.
Rusty
